doc.field: The Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel was designed much like the triumphal arches you may have seen from the Roman Empire, with one large arch and surrounded by two smaller ones each side. You may also like <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france rome history architecture roman arcdetriompheducarrousel vision:outdoor098

A photo showing the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel with many tourists looking at it, or taking photos just as we were. Even more photos like these at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
The Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

While looking on at the Arc de Triomphe du Carousel we were lucky to see army helicopters fly over head from the Place de la Concorde, over the arch, followed by going over the Louvre. More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france architecture army helicopters flyover arcdetriompheducarrousel vision:clouds0679 vision:sky0866 vision:outdoor0985
The Arc de Triomphe with army helicopters

The Tuileries Gardens and the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel are found in between the Louvre Museum and Place de la Concorde, making it just one of the popular places to visit in the area, as can be seen with the amount of people around in the photo. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france gardens garden jardin tuileries tuileriesgardens arcdetriompheducarrousel
Tuileries and Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

This side of the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel you enjoy its great architecture and views which lead onto the Tuilleries Gardens. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france gardens architecture arcdetriompheducarrousel tuilleriesgardens vision:outdoor099
One side of the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

A close up photo of the structure of Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel showing some of the amazing carvings and the architecture that went into the construction that was commissioned by Napoleon Bonaparte I. Interested for me? Go to <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
Architecture on the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

Taken while standing beneath the smaller arch inside the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel you can see the fantastic details which are all over the building and the main arch as well as just one of the brilliant columns. More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france architecture design details decoration arcdetriompheducarrousel
Ceiling decorations of the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

To get to the Arc de Triomphe you need to use an underground pass as there is no way you can access it from over the road, as can be seen in this photo it is a very busy intersection. More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france arch arc arcdetriomphe vision:text063 vision:outdoor0983
The Arc de Triomphe in Paris

When standing beneath the Arc de Triomphe you get a feeling for just how large it is and the detail lthat went into it, as you can see in this photo the amazing architecture that can be seen all around including on the ceiling above. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france architecture arch details arc arcdetriomphe vision:text0712 vision:outdoor0658
Looking up at the Arc de Triomphe

This photo we took when we first arrived at the Arc de Triomphe shows the many details and patterns which cover not just the side but also the ceiling beneath the Arc de Triomphe. More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france architecture design arch patterns arc arcdetriomphe vision:text0706 vision:outdoor0816
Side of the Arc de Triomphe

Just one of the statues - or sculpture that can be found on each column of the Arc de Triomphe which all have impressive detail, such as the feathers and wings in this photo. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel sculpture paris france statue arch details arc arcdetriomphe vision:outdoor0987
Sculpture on the column of the Arc de Triomphe

This photo taken while beneath and between the columns which make up the Arc de Triomphe you can start to get a feel for just how large the structure is, as well as admire the detail which has gone into every corner. You may be interested in more; <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france design arch details arc tall arcdetriomphe vision:text0702 vision:outdoor083

This photo shows the amazing Arc de Triomphe, showing just a couple of the statues which are on this side, being about 13 metres tall each. To see more go to <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france statue design arch arc statues relief arcdetriomphe vision:text0638 vision:outdoor095

Taken while looking up at the amazing arch, showing the great architecture as well as the designs on the underneath ceiling and the smaller arches on each side. Daily updates at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france architecture arch arc arcdetriomphe vision:outdoor0978 vision:sky0542

A Quadriga is a chariot pulled by four horses, yet this collection of statues is in fact a copy of the original statues which were stolen by Napoleon form Austria, but after the Battle of Waterloo which was lost the statues were returned but was soon replaced by a copy of the same statues to fill the space. Daily updates at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
horses people paris france history statue architecture austria war statues arcdetriompheducarrousel
Quadriga statue on the Arc de Triomphe du Carrousel

The Pont Alexandre III bridge has some detailed columns which stand at 17 meters tall, boasting golden statues on top which are a great contrast to the glass roof of the Grand Palais in the background. You may be interested in more; <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france pontalexandre pontalexandreiii grandpalais vision:mountain0621 vision:outdoor099
Pont Alexandre III bridge columns and the Grand Palais

A photo showing the full Pont Alexandre III bridge over the River Seine with the four golden statues and with the Eiffel Tower in the near distance. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france tower seine river eiffeltower eiffel pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine vision:mountain0521
Pont Alexandre III and the Eiffel Tower

On top of the support columns for the Pont Alexandre III bridge there are many different statues such as this one showing Fames restraining Pegasus. More photos to be seen at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france statue pegasus statues pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine
Golden Statue At Pont Alexandre III

A photo taken while standing at one end of the Pont Alexandre III towards the Grand Palais, showing just how large the glass and steel roof is amazing but also the largest of its like in the world. Want to learn more? Go to <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel paris france building architecture pontalexandre pontalexandreiii grandpalais vision:mountain0667 vision:outdoor099 vision:sky0689
From the Pont Alexandre III to Grand Palais

One of the Bateaux Parisiens boats going under the elegant bridge of the Pont Alexandre III, showing just how large the boats are in comparison to a bridge all of which can provide documentary for tourists. You may also like <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france boat tour tours pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine bateauxparisien
Bateaux Parisiens and the Pont Alexandre III

This photo shows one of the very impressive lamp posts you can find on the Pont Alexandre III bridge, created by the sculptor H Gauquic who made it to show cupids and sea monsters to surround the candelabra lamp post. More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge sculpture paris france art monster lamppost monsters cupid seamonster sculptures pontalexandre pontalexandreiii cupids riverseine vision:outdoor099 vision:sky0749
Ornate lampposts at Pont Alexandre III

Taken while walking along the Pont Alexandre III Bridge we managed to get a great shot of the glass roof of the Grand Palais along with one of the highly detailed and ornate pillars on the bridge as well. You may also like <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel bridge roof paris france building architecture pillar pontalexandreiii grandpalais vision:outdoor099 vision:sky0617
From the Pont Alexandre to the Grand Palais

This photo we took shows the Pont Alexandre III bridge with all four of the golden statues visible, leading to the Grand Palais which are both now classed as historical monuments in Paris. You may also like <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel bridge paris france pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine grandpalais vision:mountain0547 vision:outdoor099 vision:sky0659 vision:street0713
Pont Alexandre bridge leading to the Grand Palais

Just one of the many statues which top of columns at the Pont Alexandre III bridge, each of which have a theme and name, as well as this photo showing one of the ornate lampposts which are also found along it. You may be interested in more; <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france lamp post statues lamppost pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine staute
Column with a statue at Pont Alexandre

This photo shows a boat which is part of the Bateaux Parisien fleet on the edge of the bank near to the Pont Alexandre III bridge, with the famous Eiffel tower seen in the background. See more <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
bridge paris france tower boat tour eiffeltower eiffel tours pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine bateauxparisien vision:mountain0568 vision:sky0936 vision:clouds0822 vision:outdoor0968
Bateaux Parisien boat next to the Pont Alexandre

Here you can see two nymphs with the golden Russian coat of arms between them, which is in contrast to the French and Paris coat of arms on the other side of the bridge. You may also like <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
travel bridge paris france russia pontalexandre pontalexandreiii vision:car0586 vision:outdoor0967
Nymphs on the edge of the Pont Alexandre III bridge
A view from the River Seine with the Pont Alexandre III and its golden statues in the foreground with the Eiffel Tower behind it. <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france tower monument statue seine river gold golden eiffeltower statues landmark eiffel alexandre pontalexandre pontalexandreiii riverseine
View of the Eiffel Tower and Pont Alexandre III from the River Seine

You can see the famous Eiffel Tower to the left, with the Pont Alexandre III bridge in the distance with the golden statues on top of columns. Also sowing more moored boats along the stretch of the river, More information and details at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france tower seine river boats boat eiffeltower eiffel pontalexandreiii riverseine vision:beach0625
Eiffel Tower from the River Seine

As you can see here the Bateaux Parisien goes past all of the well known landmarks, including the famous Eiffel Tower and the Pont Alexandre III bridge. More photos to be seen at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
paris france boat tour eiffeltower tours pontalexandreiii riverseine bateauxparisien vision:mountain0664 vision:clouds0527 vision:outdoor0975 vision:sky068
Sightseeing tours and the Eiffel Tower

At the Pont Alexandre III on a bright day you can see that the golden statues on top of the pillars standing out compare to the elegant yet black lamp posts which line the sides of the bridge. See more Paris Photos at <a href"http:www.eutouring.com" rel"nofollow">www.eutouring.com<a>
